author: nickyjacob
title: The Developer List
description:
It is hard to find

A senior developer who is open to mentor young developers
A developer who is open to do some development gigs for enterprises and startups

f6_assessments.q0: The issue being not able to find a senior developer who is willing to mentor young developers and also non availability of developers who is ready to do some development gigs for enterprises and startups. The proposer wants to solve this by creating a platform where developers who are open to mentor or work on small gigs on cardano can list their gig. This will be helpful for projects on cardano to find right developers for their project intern helping the cardano ecosystem. This proposal can be scaled to included other job roles has well. Therefore this proposal does addresses the challenge effectively
f6_assessments.q1: By the information given in proposal the proposer has the experience working on web3 and fintech. Based on past projects they have worked it can be said the proposer and their team has relevant skills and experience to carry out this proposal successfully. The proposer has given clear explanation about the plan and how it would be implemented. The budget of $25500 seems reasonable for the work needed to be done. They do have taken in account all possible risks and have also provided the steps to mitigate the risks. With all these information it can be said that this proposal will be executed successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal do have step by step milestones to be achieved with a time horizon which will be helpful for the auditors. Detailed fund breakdown also helps to track the progress of the proposal. The proposer has also mentioned the ways to measure the success of the proposal and have also mentioned how success of the proposal would look like. The proposal do consist of Sustainable Development Goals which will also be helpful to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: An excellent solution to the issue at hand. The campaign brief and the problem statement are very well aligned, as is the suggested remedy. There are several tools readily available for hiring people with the required skills, but it is quite insufficient when it comes to blockchain developers, there are so many more criteria and previous experiences that matter when hiring given the scarcity of exceptional developers and the existing tools may be too generic to identify such things. The proposer seems to have a solution for the above issue. A designated tool where the Cardano or blockchain developers, in general, can sign up and get hired from professionals working on projects. This proposal could actually end up making the Cardano ecosystem self-sufficient and independent of external hiring needs. It could end up bringing in more developers onto the chain once they realize that their talents are put to the right use and even bring more entrepreneurs who are looking to bring their projects to life once they have a portal such as this to assess the technical capacities of the developers available to work with them.
f6_assessments.q1: The submission's milestones and comprehensive plan seem logical and doable. An effective deployment would actually benefit the entire community. The proposer definitely makes an elaborate introduction of the team and the members are no doubt competent to do something of this sort. Despite being a great proposal, the proposer seems to miss out on some key details. The plan provided even though mentions the monthly milestones, but there are not many details about the technology stack the team is planning to develop the portal. The plan is too abstract for us to draw any conclusive decision regarding the capabilities of the tool. The budget also follows a similar notion, the high-level division of the funds looks very transparent but it would have helped if the kind of work each of the roles would be doing in the detailed plan. Provided all the above information, the chances of the plan being implemented successfully are still high. Therefore, I rate feasibility with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2: The audit metrics defined by the proposer are very direct and simple to measure. The open-source nature makes progress tracking easier along with other documents such as regular reports and final documentation once the project is completed. The success metrics are also very brief hoping to onboard at least 100 senior developers who would be willing to mentor and enterprises willing to hire. But there is not much to look forward to apart from that. Announcements over some channels at regular intervals might help the community easily get updates about the progress. Maybe some campaigns to draw people into the portal and incentives to senior developers might draw more attention to the tool in the initial stages. Henceforth, a dainty bit of attention to these additional metrics can make the proposal a heavyweight in this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: Development on Cardano has been at an all-time high for months now. With the upcoming Vasil hardfork and many projects almost ready for launch, we can anticipate that more developers will be interested in building on Cardano. Especially with all the new tools and open-source coding that allows for easier building. This "Developer List" plans to address the challenge of newer developers finding projects to work on, by creating a place where these developers can share their skills and experience and get onboarded on a team. Whether it's small projects or becoming on a part of a long-term team. It gives more developers access to positions to use their skills. This will help the Cardano ecosystem because it will give more experience to junior developers and will lead the next generation of developers to continue building on Cardano. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: It is important to see that there is information on the team that plans to carry-out this proposal. It gives their information and provides their experience and skills. This is extremely important because it helps suggest that the team will be able to complete the Developer List they propose to build. Another indicator that will help assume the likelihood of this proposal being implemented successfully is the detailed roadmap and budget breakdown. The proposal includes a roadmap that has a specific timeline of 6 months. There is information included on what will be happening throughout these 6 months. That is important because it will help the community to hold them accountable to those time frames. The budget breakdown is extremely important. It shows exactly where the requested funds would be allocated. I was surprised to see how conservative the proposal was. The funds requested are far less than other proposals in the Catalyst Fund. For these reasons, I am led to believe that this project has a high likelihood of implementing their proposal successfully. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: When determining the likelihood of a successful proposal there are two metrics that I find to be extremely important. The first of these is transparency. This principle is extremely important because it is a tool to build trust with the community. This proposal of creating a "Developer List" will help the team to be transparent with the community and the devs. The second principle is accountability. These two principles together help determine the auditability and potential success of the proposal. Once there is trust built with the community and devs, they can help the team stay accountable to the proposal. This will help ensure that the proposal is executed properly. Including the community will be one of the most important indicators of a determined team. For these reasons, I give this section 5 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal suggests building a marketplace for young developers who want to seek support and advice from senior ones and for project managers who want to hire senior developers to work on an hourly basis. This solution will benefit both young developers, senior ones, and enterprises as well. The proposal explained three points that this project will develop. It will help showcase the profile of developers, arrange the schedule for meetings between developers and enterprises who want to hire them and payment services and there is also an area for feedback and rating system as well. Each part of this project was mentioned in detail. The proposal did not analyze how this solution will attract more developers to join the Cardano ecosystem. It should mention more about the result of this project. For example, the list of developers would be a great source for enterprises to seek partners working on their projects, and from that senior developers could earn more apart from their full-time job. This will incentivize the senior developers to join the Cardano ecosystem as it has a channel so that they could get more jobs. Besides, young developers could use the list to seek advice and support to develop themselves. However, the proposal did not emphasize much how beneficial this project is and show how impactful it is to its target audiences. There are two risks that this proposal mentioned and the good point is that it includes the detail of how to mitigate those risks.
f6_assessments.q1: About the plan for executing this project, it mentioned what to be achieved in each month, but it would be better if it included more detail about what tasks should be done and how they should be done then conclude the result should get each month. The budget would be used for the development of backend APIs & apps for the Developer. And how the budget is calculated was given in great detail. It was calculated by hours, but it should mention how long this budget would be spent for, how many months to be more exact. About the team working on this project, it listed the name of some members with their experience, which is good to showcase how suitable they are for the project and how they can help lead the project go on the right direction.
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of audibility, it mentioned that there would be a file to mark whether smaller tasks have been done or not. From that file, it could be traced and traced the progress. However, it should include that file here in the proposal for references. It also mentioned reports will be submitted, but how many times a month reports would be sent. More figures should be given to help evaluate at a certain time milestone, what has been achieved so far and what should be improved in the future. The description of the success is not clear. It should include the timeframe for the goal. Achieving 100 developers joining to be mentors but how long it should take to achieve that figure. And this project also will offer developers on the list part-time job opportunities, so it would be clearer if the criteria for evaluating the success also mentioned how many developers find jobs thanks to this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The main aim of the project is to build and develop a listing platform as a marketplace that allows developers on Cardano to find and access mentors or sign up to work for small contracts or start-up companies. For young developers, this will be an opportunity for them to get advice for their ideas, improve work efficiency, increase experience and enrich their working profile thanks by subscribing to work on small projects. For small startups, this will save them money on finding and recruiting resources for their project. For advisors, this will be a new income stream from providing consulting. Overall, this project is completely in line with Challenge's goal of being a great experience for young developers so that they are motivated to work and contribute to the Cardano blockchain. The description of the platform is clear including how it works, the main functional nodes, the main user objects, and the benefits they will receive. The biggest risk about how to attract the target audience to agree to participate in the platform has also been presented by the author and the optimal measure is marketing.
f6_assessments.q1: The project development roadmap is designed to make it easy to track its progress, the necessary information such as time, tasks, outputs, and ancillary work is not left out. The formula for working hours x respective remuneration is used to calculate the cost of specialists working on this project. This is a very good formula for facilitating comparisons and assessing the reasonableness of budget requirements. Personnel descriptions are presented in the form of project roles - relevant work experience - portfolios. The presentation makes it easy to verify and evaluate the appropriateness between the working position and work experience of each member to ensure the good implementation of this project. The success of this project is unquestionable.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap for successful assessment after the platform is completed should be more clearly designed, although some KPIs have been put in place, it is missing a milestone for performing a KPI audit. In addition, to be able to provide an overview of future project success, we need many short, medium, and long term milestones, not just one. The plus point is that the proponents have clear descriptions of how they will deliver the results reports to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal wants to build a project to help connect senior developers with young developers or project managers on Cardano. The aim of the project is to create a marketplace where 3 main parts are listed: developer profile, scheduling and payment services, and feedback and rating system. Younger developers and project managers will base on developer profiles to find technical support from senior developers, especially Haskell. The project will benefit developers and project managers, especially Cardano eco-system.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of the project is developers. Most members of the team are experienced developers. The information links about them are listed very clearly. Their project will last for 6 months. The first 3 months will be used for development activities. The next 3 months will be used for operational activities. They need $25500 for the whole project.
f6_assessments.q2: The team of the project list has metrics for the progress of the project. They will upload the latest code on Gitlab so all people can view and test the code. In addition, they will also have regular reports on the progress of the project "The Developer List". However, for this project, the team needs a campaign for promotion. The more people know about this developer list project, the more people will use its services.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is in complete alignment with the demands of the challenge. The proposal intends to build a platform for junior developers where they can seek help from senior developers. In my opinion this would provide great value to the community given that there would be shared knowledge between developers and this is going to maximize efficiency. At the moment developers ask question to each other on different social media platforms like Twitter and Reddit however this proposal intends to concentrate all of this into one single location. Such a platfor will provide mentorship for young developers but at the same time would give senior developers the full power of community behind. For example if they need help with a project they would be able to gain a lot of insights just by reading the feedbacks of the community. According to the proposal the platform is going to have a payment options where senior developers would get paid for the time and effort they put in by the junior developers said roughly. For this part I have one suggestion for the team, what if instead of money the platform rewards the senior developers with points and reputation inside the community, and this way they may get rewarded by finding better jobs or better projects. Not everybody has the financial means to hire a private tutor for programming. It can be really expensive and can take a lot of time as well, so if the team is able to refine this idea in something else that doesn’t envolve paying money to the senior developers I belive that this project will have the ability to scale and have a global impact. Other than this issue this is a really solid and well aligned project.
f6_assessments.q1: In this part the team has included a detailed timeline. All the task that will be performed are explained in great detail and they intend to deliver the whole project in 6 months which is a very realistic and achievable timeline. In addition the team has provided a very informative list of all the people that are going to be involved in this project. Additional links to the team members LinkedIn accounts are porvided as well. After looking into them in great detail there is no doubt that this team is able to complete this project. The posses all the necessary skills and experience. Finally, about the financial split, they intend to pay junior developers $25 /hour and senior developers $35 /hour. This rates are very reasonable given the experience and the skills of the team. The financial split is done perfectly an all the money are accounted for.
f6_assessments.q2: The provided KPIs are brief but there is clarity in this part as well. Measuring the success of this proposal will be very easy because the team intends to provide full transparancy by publishing all the finished tasks and timely reports. Moreover, the team intends to publish all of their code so all community members can view or test if they want. The success for this project is based on the number of users (junior and senior developers). The team aims to reach a number of 100 senior developers that will provide council and mentorship. I also would suggest that the team provide a rough date on how long after launch do they anticipate to reach their goals. But this is just an extra, the audit part is pretty solid and deserves highest marks.

f6_assessments.q0: In order to make the Developer Ecosystem in Cardano Community grow and expand we need to focus on the relation between young and senior developers. Senior developers are often busy in well paid gigs and don’t have the time or energy to mentor young developers. Listing and having the available data for contacting senior developers who will be ready for mentoring and working in small projects with young developers seems to be a really effective way to address the challenge. Although, this might not be enough to draw in the attention of senior developers and get them to mentor young developers. Mentoring should be rewarded economically so Senior developers find it attractive, it cannot only depend on the good will or intentions of a couple and few Senior developers. Budget in this project could also include generous fees for experienced and high-calibre Senior developers.
f6_assessments.q1: Experience and plan presented seems consistent although it might need a readjustment of budget in regards of the Senior developers fee to be successfully implemented. Relying only on the free will to volunteer might not be enough to complete their goal. Also, in order to draw in new developers and students this proposal will also need a strong media and communication plan. Nevertheless, it is interesting to take into account that they look forward to expanding their funding in following Funds if they find the proposal to be a success within the Community. Supporting this type of long-term projects is fundamental for our biggest challenges.
f6_assessments.q2: Dividing the project into smaller tasks based on progress might be the key to successfully audit this proposal. Gitlab and Tokenlist will be available for a successful auditability and sharing within the Cardano Community. Although a more concrete disposal of timely reports can help the auditability process, that might be the weak point of the auditability proposal. Funding this proposal and accompanying them in this can be enough for helping it achieve its success. Developing more dynamic linkage between young and Senior developers is fundamental for the Developer Ecosystem within Cardano Community.

f6_assessments.q0:
The team realizes that it is not easy to find senior developers willing to mentor new developers and willing to do some development contracts for businesses and startups. The community desperately needs these senior developers. Faced with this situation, the team came up with a solution to create a platform containing a list of seniors capable of mentoring young developers and working on small gigs. I think this is a good idea and can bring many benefits to the community, especially young developers.
Project features are covered in great detail by the proposers. The project consists of 3 areas of Developer Profile, Scheduling and Billing Services, Feedback, and Rating System. Each area is explained in detail. The function of each part of the project is also described in detail. The proposers showed how the project works through the proposal. The object of the project is clearly defined. The project is aimed at young developers who are in need of mentoring from the forerunners in the community. From the content mentioned in the proposal, the community can assess the impact of the project on the subjects and the whole Cardano community.
However, the proposal does not yet state how the project will address the problems posed by the Challenge. In this section, the proposers should outline the outcomes that the project will achieve upon completion or after communication. The team should show content showing that these results are in sync with the KPIs / key metrics set by the Challenge. These contents should be clearly shown in each phase.
The team identified 2 issues that will be encountered during the project implementation including Convincing senior developers and attracting businesses to work in the Cardano ecosystem community. For each risk, the team comes up with a solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team determines the project implementation time is within 6 months with the first 3 months being development activities and the last 3 months being operational activities. The project implementation plan is detailed in the proposal. The project's roadmap is broken down into milestones. The tasks to be performed at each stage are identified. In addition, the requirements when performing the above work items are provided. The proposal showed that a reasonable plan is not only about what they will complete, but also how it needs to be. The team provided a realistic timeline to complete the given tasks in a logical manner. The project should be appreciated for its ability to achieve its goals and potential for future development. However, to be further appreciated, the proposal should have details on technical aspects such as architecture, language, and technology required to execute the plan as well as clearly define key positions and numbers. the number of people needed to execute the project.
In general, the budget proposed by the project is quite reasonable. Investment costs and expenditure items have been specified. The budget plan is presented in an easy-to-understand way.
The proposal provided the profile of the project founding team. From these profiles, the community can determine that the project is led by people with a lot of experience in the field. They will use their inherent talent combined with skills and knowledge to bring the project to fruition.
f6_assessments.q2: The project implementation progress will be reported to the community by the team. However, the team needs to show the criteria to evaluate the success of the project. The proposers imagine what requirements a successful project will rely on. The proposal also needs to mention quantitative indicators for the community to rely on to monitor the progress of the project. The team please provide these numbers specifically. For example, the number of users, the time to complete which part - what activities, and the number of traffic ... These detailed content will show the community the potential of the project.

solution: Listing platform for developers who are open to mentor or work on small gigs (paid or unpaid) on cardano to list their profile (Project links, Linkedin, Gitlab link, Summary, hourly rates etc)
experience:
Founder of Tokenlist, Helped 3+ business build on web3.
https://thetokenlist.com/
Founder of Paysack, enabled multiple fintech founders launch their MVP without tech cofounders.
Have been part of accelerator : Techstars-Barclays Accelerator, SOSV Accelerator, KSUM, FintechYatra
